definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)

sentences.english: You are a layman in the field of oceanology.
sentences.chinese: 你在海洋学方面是个门外汉。

sentences.english: To the uninitiated, this approach may sound little better than guesswork.
sentences.chinese: 对于门外汉，这种方法听起来比猜测好不了多少。

sentences.english: He cannot pose any more as the disgruntled outsider.
sentences.chinese: 他再也不能把自己当作一个气哼哼的门外汉了。

sentences.english: Bi- metal foil is strongly recommended for quick authentication by the layman.
sentences.chinese: 双金属箔强烈建议快速验证的门外汉。

sentences.english: If satisfied Shanseng see Office Solutions Direct Rao know Dayton forget, still a layman.
sentences.chinese: 若纳山僧见处，直饶知解顿忘，犹是门外汉。

sentences.english: More than any other detail of biohacking, this is the one that laymen grasp.
sentences.chinese: 无需更多说明，下面就是一个门外汉的所作所为。

sentences.english: He always modestly calls himself a laymen in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 他总是谦称自己是书法艺术的门外汉。

sentences.english: The committee， headed by a layman， resigned in protest.
sentences.chinese: 由门外汉率领的该委员会在郑重声明中辞职。

definition: lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
switch to a job one was not trained for
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
different trades, worlds apart (idiom); to sb outside the profession, it is a closed book
experienced person/an old hand at sth
novice/new hand/sb new to a job
